p: In 2018, a pilot study was performed to detect respiratory viruses in Singaporeâ€™s Mass Rapid Transit network[ 28]. A total of 89 aerosol samples were collected during peak Mass Rapid Transit ridership hours using noninvasive bioaerosol samplers over 52 wk and tested using real-time RT-PCR: nine (10%) tested positive for adenovirus, four (4.5%) tested positive for RSV type A, and one (1%) tested positive for influenza A virus (IAV). These data show the presence of viruses in crowded public spaces[ 28].
